data.title: A Temple Away
data.text:
My brother and I were exploring Alhambra and decided it was time to  for lunch. We drove around downtown and decided upon Thai Purple. 

There was plenty of parking spaces;  However most of the meter spaces were for 30-45 minute and we thought it was too short a time for lunch.

We parked and walked to this restaurant from the back.  It was a quiet place, all decorated with Thai statues, flowers and oriental pictures.  There was a row of booths and then open tables and chairs.  We opt for booth instead.

It was Tuesday and there was a lunch box special for about $8 with drinks. Anything else would be add on.  For example, fried rice with egg would be two dollars more. We submitted our order.  It came quickly like the Japanese Bento lunch box.

The fried fish and steak orders were just right.  We were satisfied with the food and good service.  The place open from 11:00 am to 10:00 pm, from Sunday to Thursday.

Thai Purple is located on 27 North Garfield Avenue, in downtown Alhambra, California (626) 300-9083.   

If one is ever in this part of town, drop by Thai Purple.  Cant go wrong and the price is right too!

data.title: A great atmosphere
data.text: Was there for lunch and the Thai artifacts and decoration was really great.  The set lunch choices are very good.  More than enough food, soup and drink.

data.title: Excellent food, but the TVs in the restaurant are totally obnoxious.
data.text:
The food here is really good! We had the pad Thai and it was so delicious. The spring rolls were different, not to our liking. They had shrimp in them and were very large spring rolls. 

Our biggest gripe of this restaurant where the televisions that were all over the small dining room. They were loud and huge and the news was on, which was extremely devastating and sad. The restaurant would be quite quaint if it weren't for those TVs. We would go back, but we would not dine in.

data.title: amazing food
data.text: Very cool atmosphere ,,Pretty interior deco comes with super tatsy food ...staff was bit hurried since we arrived at the time they close ....Food was just out of the world ....good treat ..

data.title: Excellent
data.text:
Very nice and balanced food. Excellent quality. Not disappointed at all. 
Very good service. Affordable!

data.title: Expected freshly made food
data.text: When first arriving to restaurant was not greeted right away. Only two tables were occupied. Two waiters with ear buds were standing ar the counter next to kithen.  A table was pointed to me that was empty. Had to ask  waiter to clean table when he brought the menu.  After reading reviews, I decided to try the Tuesday special, Pad Thai and was disappointed. The noodles were mushy, very sweet, chicken pieces of low quality, and shrimp was not fresh. Only thing fresh was the green onions. Ordered the yellow curry and it tasted like chemicals had been added. Could hardly tasted the curry or  coconut milk and spicy. I had asked for spicy. I added condiments hoping to improve the taste but unsuccessful. There was more soup than contents. Ordered Jasmine tea which is made with loose tea. Noone asked if I needed more water. Had to wait quite awhile for check. Pad Thai not 3.99, is now 4.99, not worth it. Curry was about 8.00.  Could't eat  much of the food so took leftovers home for my dog. I hadn't been to this restaurant for about 5 years when my grown daughter brought me.  Food was better then. I will not go back again. Just was convenient because I was in the area. I will stick with my regular Thai places in Eagle Rock, Pasadena, Highland Park, Wilshire area.

data.title: Good Thai Food
data.text: I took my daughter here for lunch. The food is good. The wait staff was not very attentive. We had the lunch special that allows you to choose an appetizer, an entree, and comes with soup, salad, rice and a drink. $1 extra for white meat chicken. $1.50 extra for brown or fried rice. Also, we ordered a separate order of pot stickers. All the food was good and the atmosphere was good. The waiter was a little slow, but overall, everything is good. I'll go back for lunch.

data.title: Pretty good Pattay.
data.text: It's one of the best tasting Pattay in the SGV area. They have a pretty good deal with a buy two get one free drink, and they also have lunch specials which is nice.

data.title: Tuesday Pad Thai
data.text: If you've heard of Tuesday Tacos and enjoy the savings....Tuesday Pad Thai may be the thing for you.  We go there on Tuesdays to get their special price for pad thai noodles.  It is a good deal @ $3.99!  Love it.

data.title: Pad Thai is tops!
data.text: Heavy Thai atmosphere, and an extensive menu.  I have only gotten the Pad Thai because that's what I like.  But there is so much more.  Parking is now resolved with the new adjacent city parking lot.  Movie theater across the street in the center of town (at Main & Garfield).  Just stop by after theater for a meal.

data.title: Don't Go For Lunch on a School Day
data.text:
We arrived at noon because we wanted to try the lunch special.  We were a party of two and received one menu, full of lunch specials ranging in price from $5.99 to $6.25, including soup and rice.  We had to ask for the "other" lunch special menu that had combinations to choose from, mostly 6.99, including soup, salad, rice and drink.  A much better deal, but you had to know to ask for it.

At 12:30 the restaurant filled with students, I think from the local high school down the block.  This completely swamped the kitchen and wait staff, so no more service for us.  I had to get up to find refills for our water.

Don't order the mint chicken.  It's very little chicken, but lots of green bell peppers, which I hate, and they weren't mentioned in the description, and a little mint sitting in a container of greasy oil.  Horrible.  Salad was good, rice was rice, and BBQ chicken was tasteless.  Won't be going back.

data.title: Great Food and Service - Low Cost experience
data.text: We had a business meeting in Alhambra and after driving there from Long Beach wanted an easy dinner before settling into our hotel to watch the Miami Heat Final Game.  There is ample city parking behind the restaurant and the food was well presented and very delicious.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Very good lunch specials!
data.text:
I love Thai food!   This is a fast food/seat down restaurant! Service is fast if you have little time to eat. Lunch packages are great including a free drink all under $6!

I will be back!
Michael D

data.title: Food is good but the service is okay.  don't expect to get your change back unless you ask.
data.text: Food is good but the service is okay.  don't expect to get your change back unless you ask.

data.title: This is by far my most favorite Thai restaurant to dine at. The prices are reasonable and if you don't like it as much...
data.text: This is by far my most favorite Thai restaurant to dine at. The prices are reasonable and if you don't like it as much as I do, then that's your problem. The service is not too bad either but the parking situation really blows.

data.title: excellent thai food
data.text: excellent authentic thai food, outside of Hollywood.  nice friendly service from this family style restaurant.

data.title: I miss ♡ Thai Purple
data.text:
학교 마치면 가곤했던 'Thai Purple' ♡
매주 수요일  '파타이데이'면 저렴한 가격에, 친구들과 함께 한 추억의 장소
